FacilityName: Krown Inc DBA Hi Yield Products

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Krown, Inc. dba Hi-Yield Products

67701 310th Street

Hartland, MN 56042



For further information contact Kyle Reed, Plant Manager (507) 845-2235



Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



1.     The Facility Policy



         The owners, management, and employees of Krown, Inc. dba Hi-Yield Products are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an

         accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local Fire Department or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the 

         impact of the release to the people and the environment. A "Site Safety Coordinator" is identified and used as an extension of the General Manager for a "hands-on"

         manager of the day to day safe working activities, maintain the required regulatory recordkeeping, conduct monthly safety meetings, conduct employee training, and 

         act as the location's contact during emergency incidents that are rehearsed biannually. This facility's management and employees are enrolled in a Regulatory 

         Management Service that assists in maintaining and administering comprehensive safety and environmental programs, procedures, and training courses.



2.     Facility Information



         The primary activity at the facility is the storage and blending of fertilizers for sale to farmers.



         Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application. Anhydrous ammonia is used for crop production nutrients.



         The maximum quantity of anhydrous ammonia stored would be 665,300 pounds in our (4) 30,000 gallon storage tanks and nurse tanks used at this facility. The maximum

         quantity handled in a single operation would be the unloading of a tank truck holding 40,000 pounds.



3.     The Worst Case Scenario and the Alternative Release Scenario.



         This facility has developed a worst-case and alternative-case scenario, however it is not to be

included in this Executive Summary as requested by EPA.



4.     The Accidental Release Prevention Program



         The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements For the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published by the American National

         Standards Institute, Inc. and the Standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous

         Ammonia.",EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule,and in addition the Minnesota Department of Agriculture Rules.



5.     The Five Year Accident History.



         There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: Have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the 

         facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



6.     The Emergency Response Program.



         The Facility has:



            A. A written Emergency Response Action Plan in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



            B. Provided State and Local Authorities the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to Know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).



            C. Coordinated with Local Emergency Responders.



7.     Planned Changes to Improve Safety.



         Safety improvement is an ongoing process at this facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no additional

         specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
